text: what in incentive does is we've got a
network today of almost
180,000 what we call solvers from around
the world 200 plus countries 60% of them
have Masters and phds they have
backgrounds and everything from uh
aerospace engineering you know to you
know to um civil engineering uh chemists
to you know doctors and what they what
they are is they're available to work on
problems now to answer your question in
our style of innovation it's not about
managing the workforce we do that via
the model we we engage in for the
Enterprise so if the Enterprise has been
able to identify effectively that it
needs a uh you know a new kind of a um
material for a product it wants to take
to Market and it's been unable to
develop that material what it will do is
it will work with an incentive or
another
and develop a what we call a problem
statement and that problem statement is
a well-defined need and success criteria
coupled with an inducement call it a
prize so for $50,000 if anybody in the
world can solve this problem for me for
$50,000 um I'll take that intellectual
property and and and and and gladly pay
you the prize now this is a really
important model because what it does is
it changes the question from how do you
manage a global Workforce of smart
intelligent creative people to how do I
get everybody in the world who's capable
ready willing and able to work on this
kind of a problem you know going to work
on the problem for me and I really only
want to pay for Success so this prize
based or inducement based model turns
out to be incredibly powerful
